verses.roman:
tad-abhijño 'pi bhagavān
sarvātmā sarva-darśanaḥ
praśrayāvanato 'pṛcchad
vṛddhān nanda-purogamān

synonyms: tat-abhijñaḥ—being in full knowledge about it; api—although; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; sarva-ātmā—the Supersoul within everyone's heart; sarva-darśanaḥ—the omniscient Personality of Godhead; praśraya-avanataḥ—bowing down humbly; apṛcchat—He inquired; vṛddhān—from the elders; nanda-puraḥ-gamān—headed by Mahārāja Nanda.
translation: Being the omniscient Supersoul, the Supreme Lord Kṛṣṇa already understood the situation, yet He still humbly inquired from the elders, headed by His father, Nanda Mahārāja.

purport.content: Lord Kṛṣṇa was eager to enact His pastime of lifting Govardhana Hill and defeating the false pride of Indra, and thus He cleverly inquired from His father about the imminent sacrifice.
